data.title: The Fed's favorite inflation measure fell in April, but prices are still uncomfortably high
data.description: Another key tracker of consumer prices took a breather in April, the Commerce Department reported Friday.

data.title: Mansions in Boca Raton are commanding Miami Beach prices. Here's a look inside
data.description: Ultra-high-end real estate in Boca Raton, Florida, is on a stratospheric rise, breaking record sale prices every year for five consecutive years.

data.title: Home sellers are lowering their prices at the fastest clip since 2019
data.description: Interest in the housing market seems to be levelling off due to increased homeownership costs.

data.title: Russian stocks may be 'essentially worthless,' MSCI research suggests
data.description: Russian stocks may have "no value" compared to the prices listed on the Moscow Exchange, new research from MSCI has suggested.

data.title: The Fed's preferred gauge shows inflation rose 4.9% in April in a sign that price increases could be slowing
data.description: The personal consumption expenditures price index inflation gauge was expected to increase 4.9% from a year ago, according to Dow Jones estimates.

data.title: Morgan Stanley downgrades Gap after weak first-quarter report, says stock has further downside
data.description: Gap shares were under pressure on Friday after the company reported a wider-than-expected loss for the first quarter, leading to downgrades from Wall Street.

data.title: What rotisserie chicken prices say about stores' inflation strategy
data.description: At the grocery store, shoppers have seen food prices increase at their fastest pace in decades. Yet the price of one hot, juicy, spit-roasted favorite hasn't budged at several top chains: rotisserie chickens.
